  • Scrum in Action - Understanding User Stories, Sprints, and Team Dynamics

    By Romain Basly on November 30, 2024

    In our first article, we explored its origins and the fundamentals of its process. Now, it’s time to dive deeper. In this piece, we’ll describe the key components that make Scrum so effective: the concept of User Stories, the rhythm of sprints shaped by ceremonies, and the pivotal role of the team. We’ll wrap up this series with a final article that reflects on the bigger picture and challenges of Scrum. (More ...)

  • Scrum Framework - The origins

    By Romain Basly on November 29, 2024

    The world appears to have developed a fascination for the Scrum framework. It is now the standard in the tech industry and is expanding daily into new sectors of the economy. The question we aim to address in this series of articles is: What exactly is it? How is it different? Why should you consider adopting it for your own projects? And more importantly, when is it likely less appropriate for your type of activity ?(More ...)
